entry.title: George Fox University announces fall 2025 dean's list
entry.summary: NEWBERG — Douglas County students were named on the George Fox University dean's list for the 2025 fall semester.

entry.title: Local students earn degrees from George Fox University
entry.summary: NEWBERG — Three students from Douglas County received graduate or undergraduate degrees from George Fox University in the Dec. 2025 graduation ceremony.

entry.title: Police Log: February 6 - February 8, 2026
entry.summary: Warrant arrests, DUIIs and multiple citations topped Roseburg Police Logs Feb. 6–8, including a DUII crash, a hit-and-run citation, trespass arrests and several cases tied to warrants, parole violations and prohibited camping.

entry.title: How to hack time
entry.summary: By Jim Teece I have a superpower that I use to live my life to the fullest. I hack time. I do this by breaking my day into 3rds. 8 hours of work, 8 hours of sleep and 8 hours of family time. You slide the dial around if you need more sleep or more… The post How to hack time appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Umpqua Watersheds to Host Guided Snowshoe Hike at Crater Lake National Park on Feb. 14
entry.summary: Umpqua Watersheds will host a snowshoe hike at Crater Lake National Park on Feb. 14. The trip is limited to 25 people and requires reservation. Participants will meet in Roseburg or at Rim Village and should bring a sack lunch, warm winter gear and tire chains.

entry.title: Sutherlin-Based Ragin’ Reptiles Supply Expanding to Roseburg with Second Storefront
entry.summary: Sutherlin-based Ragin’ Reptiles Supply is expanding with a second storefront in Roseburg. The family-owned reptile shop plans to open the new location in early March 2026, bringing exotic pets, supplies and expertise closer to customers across Douglas County.

entry.title: Cellars & Gifts in Roseburg Announces Closure After 25 Years
entry.summary: After 25 years in Roseburg, Cellars & Gifts has announced it will close its doors. The longtime boutique thanked the community for decades of support and is offering 30% off most items during its final weeks as customers stop by to shop, share memories and say goodbye.

entry.title: Spring into Gardening Conference 2026: A day of learning, inspiration and community
entry.summary: One of the great things about gardening is that it naturally builds community. A shared love of plants brings people together to swap cuttings, share tips, build garden beds and talk about what’s growing.

entry.title: Roseburg Library connects with readers at home
entry.summary: One of Roseburg Public Library’s quietly successful programs is delivering materials to patrons in their home, and I would love for more people to participate.

entry.title: Grounds for your ground: coffee in the garden
entry.summary: Question: I drink a fair amount of coffee each day, and seem to accumulate an abundance of leftover grounds. I’ve heard that coffee grounds can be used to lower the pH in the soil and benefit acid-loving plants like rhododendrons,…

entry.title: 4-H Dog ID Contest brings youth, community partners and canine education together
entry.summary: The annual 4-H Dog ID Contest took place Saturday, Jan, 24, and once again proved to be a favorite event for youth and families, oﬀering an engaging, hands-on learning experience that connects young people with the broader canine community.

entry.title: “Coffee with Christie” Community Chat Set for Saturday at Winston City Hall
entry.summary: Winston residents can meet Mayor Christie Knutson during “Coffee with Christie” on Saturday, Feb. 7, from 10 a.m. to noon at City Hall. The informal gathering offers a chance to ask questions, share concerns, and talk about what’s happening in the city in a relaxed, open setting.

entry.title: Multi-Jurisdictional Training Exercise Planned for Downtown Roseburg on Feb. 10
entry.summary: A multi-agency emergency training exercise simulating a train car hazmat incident is scheduled Feb. 10 in downtown Roseburg. Residents may see emergency vehicles and personnel during the drill. Officials say there is no real emergency and ask the public to avoid the training area if possible.

entry.title: Police Log: February 5, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations Feb. 5–6, including theft cases, warrant and parole violation arrests, disorderly conduct, prohibited weapons in parks, and two DUII citations following traffic stops, according to the department’s daily activity logs.

entry.title: Discover Roseburg 15 Geocache Series kicks off Saturday at the Roseburg Library
entry.summary: Roseburg’s Discover Roseburg 15 geocache series kicks off Saturday, Feb. 7, at the Roseburg Public Library. The free, family-friendly event invites participants to explore the city by hunting for 20 geocaches and earning a limited-edition collector’s geocoin while supplies last.

entry.title: B's Sweet Treats hosts fundraiser for Roseburg resident with cancer
entry.summary: For fundraisers dedicated to supporting individuals with illness, it’s typically the recipient that shows gratitude for the effort. But for B’s Sweet Treat’s owner Brandon Ekman, that feeling goes both ways.

entry.title: Sutherlin-based pet shop Ragin' Reptiles Supply to open second storefront in Roseburg.

entry.title: HOPE Drug Court participants organize graduation projects for community benefit
entry.summary: This March, HOPE Drug Court will host its 112th graduation ceremony, signaling a new beginning for former drug offenders who pass the program. To get to graduation, program participants are organizing projects to better their community.
